conversation.content:
4c3264a0913f41a9b15f1ca6:
  'Description': Covers the process of upgrading or replacing hardware components
    on the device, such as adding more memory or replacing a faulty part.
  'Intent_Name': Hardware Upgrades
  'Slot':
  - 'Description': The laptop component to upgrade.
    'Identifier': 3dfd0078476945cc9d54cbeb
    'Name': component
  - 'Description': The brand of the laptop component.
    'Identifier': e1639a554e34404abb974b2b
    'Name': brand
    'Examples':
    - Crucial
    - Kingston
    - Samsung
    - WD
    - Intel
    - AMD
    - Sony
    - Dell
  - 'Description': The model of the laptop component.
    'Identifier': 17aadc0cb5bb4c33b5ea855a
    'Name': model
    'Examples':
    - DDR4
    - NVMe
    - SATA
    - i7
    - Ryzen 9
    - AC 9260
    - E4000
    - 860 EVO
  - 'Description': The size of the laptop component.
    'Identifier': b99bd1290ba34d6a8ce04d9c
    'Name': size
9688ba1a0f5348729659e714:
  'Description': Help with diagnosing and resolving issues with software
    applications, including identifying and fixing bugs, errors, and compatibility
    problems.
  'Intent_Name': Software Troubleshooting
  'Slot':
  - 'Description': The name of the software that is causing trouble.
    'Identifier': d57b08ac5a3549d4abd67b79
    'Name': software_name
  - 'Description': The type of problem encountered with the software.
    'Identifier': 5cd7a56c99e3424b8e152d13
    'Name': problem_type
  - 'Description': The exact error message displayed by the software.
    'Identifier': da24bcdb1b96434db73584b2
    'Name': error_message
dc1f5e464dfa435e91875cea:
  'Description': Indicates the device's battery is excessively hot, which
    can be a safety concern and reduce battery life.
  'Intent_Name': Battery Overheat
  'Slot':
  - 'Description': The brand of the laptop experiencing overheating issues.
    'Identifier': f1181f82bdfd4d62a89d78ce
    'Name': laptop_brand
  - 'Description': The specific model of the laptop experiencing overheating
      issues.
    'Identifier': 47ff2b0594a044c599ddd966
    'Name': laptop_model
  - 'Description': The temperature at which the laptop's battery is overheating.
    'Identifier': 0db6d8d487eb4e548262d5bc
    'Name': temperature
  - 'Description': The symptoms associated with the laptop's overheating issues.
    'Identifier': d23e434175aa4d25a3f8e5b6
    'Name': symptoms
fb043db0573c43bc8decb196:
  'Description': Refers to the device's battery losing charge faster than
    expected, often due to background apps or screen brightness.
  'Intent_Name': Battery Drain
  'Slot':
  - 'Description': The brand of the laptop experiencing battery drain issues.
    'Identifier': a70f4daa8a9145cdb3007c1d
    'Name': brand
  - 'Description': The model of the laptop experiencing battery drain issues.
    'Identifier': 19e3946976d543748b06e40b
    'Name': model
  - 'Description': The expected battery life of the laptop.
    'Identifier': 88e8c297a6b143f69f95d9fc
    'Name': battery_life
    'Examples':
    - 3 hours
    - 5 hours
    - 8 hours
    - 10 hours
    - 12 hours
  - 'Description': The duration it takes to charge the laptop's battery.
    'Identifier': 14d577e3a4ca4249bc9eb092
    'Name': charge_duration
    'Examples':
    - 1 hour
    - 2 hours
    - 3 hours
    - 4 hours
    - 5 hours
  - 'Description': The operating system of the laptop.
    'Identifier': b6398fa9aa6a4ab6b2003b0a
    'Name': os
  - 'Description': The status of software updates for the laptop.
    'Identifier': 47eedcb84a034b0cb11149c4
    'Name': software_updates
    'Examples':
    - Up-to-date
    - Outdated
fh01849t1h0f91haofi39: 
  'Description': Utterance does not match any other intent
  'Name' : No Intent

Classify the intent of the customer service message received by an IT team. The possible intents are above along with associated slots. Slots have descriptions that specify what to extract, and some include examples. The examples are not an exhaustive list and values can be valid without being listed as an example. 

Your output will be YAML. Keys will be intent IDs of intent(s) found in the message. A subdictionary of entities will contain entity ID and value pairs. If an entity is not present in the text for a matched intent, include the entity ID with a value of "None". Here is an example:

- <intent_id1>: 

   <slot_id1>: <slot1_value> 

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

- <intent_id2>: 

   <slot_id1>: <slot1_value> 

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

To demonstrate the task, here is an example of a message and an output. 

Message "my macbook gets really hot when I play games on Steam"

dc1f5e464dfa435e91875cea:
  f1181f82bdfd4d62a89d78ce: mac
  47ff2b0594a044c599ddd966: None
  0db6d8d487eb4e548262d5bc: None
  d23e434175aa4d25a3f8e5b6: playing games on Steam


Here is the message for you to classify: "i need to replace the touchpad on my computer"
